intro: Strigilia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty stigmas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The species is noted for its ability to store water in its fleshy stems and leaves, adapting to its harsh native habitat.
